snippet: Labor leaders say an episode involving a Quaker meeting house has no connection with any work dispute.
abstract: Labor leaders reject suspicions that labor disputes were behind vandalism that caused  $500,000 in damages to Quaker meeting house under construction in Philadelphia; many continue to see incident as an example of union intimidation.
lead_paragraph: Labor leaders say an episode involving a Quaker meeting house has no connection with any work dispute.

headline.seo: Philadelphia Vandalism Seen by Some as Union Intimidation
headline.main: Philadelphia Vandalism of Quaker Building Is Seen by Some as Union Intimidation
headline.print_headline: Philadelphia Vandalism of Quaker Building Is Seen by Some as Union Intimidation
